Data/O Collection/O The/O Public/M Television/M Service/M Foundation/M -LRB-/O Taiwan/O -RRB-/O 2/O kindly/O agreed/O to/O share/O their/O broadcast/O news/O with/O us/O ./O 
The/O recordings/O spanned/O the/O period/O November/O 7/O ,/O 2001/O through/O June/O 30/O ,/O 2003/O ./O 
A/O Digital/O Audio/O Tape/O -LRB-/O DAT/M -RRB-/O recorder/O ,/O which/O was/O connected/O to/O a/O broadcasting/O machine/O using/O an/O XLR/O balanced/O cable/O ,/O was/O set/O up/O in/O the/O TV/O broadcasting/O studio/O ./O 
That/O is/O ,/O the/O broadcast/O news/O speech/O was/O recorded/O at/O the/O same/O time/O it/O was/O broadcasted/O to/O avoid/O any/O modulation/O effect/O ./O 
Recordings/O are/O made/O in/O stereo/O with/O a/O 44.1/O kHz/M sampling/M rate/O and/O 16/O bit/O resolution/O ./O 
Each/O recording/O consists/O of/O a/O broadcast/O news/O episode/O 60/O minutes/O long/O ./O 
Each/O DAT/O was/O manually/O processed/O to/O convert/O the/O digital/O speech/O samples/O into/O a/O single/O Microsoft/O Windows/O wave/O file/O and/O stored/O in/O a/O hard/O disk/O ./O 
Then/O ,/O the/O signal/O was/O down-sampled/O to/O 16kHz/O with/O a/O resolution/O of/O 16/O bits/O ./O 
During/O this/O operation/O ,/O only/O the/O left/O channel/O was/O selected/O ./O 
Thus/O ,/O broadcast/O news/O speech/O in/O mono/O ,/O down-sampled/O to/O 16kHz/O with/O 16/O bit/O resolution/O was/O used/O for/O further/O transcription/O and/O annotation/O ./O 
More/O than/O 250/O one-hour/O broadcast/O news/O shows/O were/O recorded/O in/O this/O way/O ./O 
However/O ,/O we/O were/O able/O to/O transcribe/O only/O 198/O of/O them/O ./O 
Since/O video/O can/O provide/O visual/O clues/O to/O facilitate/O transcription/O and/O annotation/O ,/O video/O recordings/O were/O also/O made/O simultaneously/O with/O the/O audio/O recordings/O ./O

Transcription/O and/O Annotation/O The/O corpus/O has/O been/O segmented/O ,/O labeled/O ,/O and/O transcribed/O manually/O using/O a/O tool/O developed/O by/O DGA/M -LRB-/O Délégation/O Générale/O pour/O l'Armement/O ,/O France/O -RRB-/O and/O LDC/O ,/O called/O ''/O ''/O Transcriber/O ''/O ''/O The/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O always/O exhibits/O a/O high/O standard/O of/O fluency/O ,/O good/O pronunciation/O ,/O and/O good/O acoustic/O quality/O ./O 
Most/O of/O the/O field/O reporter/O speech/O also/O exhibits/O a/O high/O standard/O of/O fluency/O and/O good/O pronunciation/O ,/O but/O sometimes/O the/O acoustic/O quality/O is/O low/O ./O 
Some/O of/O the/O interviewee/O speech/O is/O of/O very/O low/O quality/O and/O intelligibility/O with/O background/O speech/O and/O noises/O of/O various/O types/O ,/O and/O the/O speech/O itself/O sometimes/O contains/O mispronunciations/O ,/O particles/O ,/O repetitions/O ,/O repairs/O ,/O etc./O ./O 
As/O a/O result/O ,/O much/O more/O time/O was/O required/O to/O transcribe/O and/O annotate/O the/O interviewee/O speech/O ./O

SGML/O structure/O of/O transcriptions/O Owing/O to/O the/O complexity/O and/O hierarchical/O nature/O of/O the/O additional/O information/O needed/O in/O the/O transcripts/O ,/O SGML/M was/O chosen/O by/O the/O DGA&LDC/O Transcriber/O as/O a/O suitable/O framework/O for/O formatting/O the/O text/O ./O 
The/O document/O structure/O used/O in/O all/O the/O transcripts/O is/O as/O follows/O Within/O each/O Section/O containing/O material/O to/O be/O transcribed/O ,/O there/O are/O one/O or/O more/O ''/O ``/O Segment/O ''/O ''/O elements/O ,/O corresponding/O to/O speaker/O turns/O within/O the/O Section/O ;/O the/O Segment/O attributes/O identify/O the/O speaker/O ,/O the/O speaking/O mode/O ,/O the/O channel/O fidelity/O ,/O and/O the/O points/O in/O time/O at/O which/O the/O speaker/O turn/O begins/O and/O ends/O ./O 
At/O any/O point/O within/O an/O Episode/O ,/O a/O Section/O or/O a/O Segment/O where/O there/O is/O a/O change/O in/O the/O presence/O of/O music/O ,/O background/O voices/O ,/O or/O other/O noises/O ,/O a/O ''/O ``/O Background/O ''/O ''/O element/O is/O inserted/O to/O mark/O the/O change/O ;/O the/O Background/O attributes/O identify/O the/O type/O of/O background/O -LRB-/O music/O ,/O speech/O ,/O other/O ,/O and/O shh/O -RRB-/O and/O the/O point/O in/O time/O at/O which/O the/O change/O occurs/O ./O 
Automatic/O generation/O of/O initial/O transcriptions/O After/O we/O examined/O the/O anchor/O scripts/O on/O the/O website/O of/O the/O TV/O broadcaster/O ,/O we/O found/O that/O they/O matched/O the/O content/O of/O the/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O rather/O well/O ./O 
This/O observation/O led/O us/O to/O design/O an/O automatic/O tool/O to/O generate/O initial/O transcription/O files/O for/O our/O transcribers/O to/O start/O with/O ./O 
The/O flowchart/O of/O the/O tool/O for/O generating/O initial/O transcriptions/O is/O depicted/O in/O The/O story/O segmentation/O module/O first/O performs/O speaker/O and/O environment/O change/O detection/O ,/O followed/O by/O hierarchical/O clustering/O of/O audio/O segments/O ./O 
We/O assume/O that/O the/O largest/O cluster/O is/O the/O studio/O anchor/O cluster/O ,/O and/O that/O every/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O segment/O is/O the/O first/O segment/O of/O a/O story/O ./O 
Thus/O ,/O the/O number/O of/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O segments/O corresponds/O to/O the/O number/O of/O stories/O in/O the/O audio/O stream/O ,/O and/O the/O starting/O time/O of/O a/O story/O is/O the/O starting/O time/O of/O its/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O segment/O ./O 
The/O speech/O recognition/O module/O transcribes/O all/O the/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O segments/O ,/O and/O the/O anchor/O script/O alignment/O module/O aligns/O the/O anchor/O scripts/O with/O the/O recognition/O output/O ./O 
Here/O ,/O we/O use/O a/O vector-space-model-based/M information/M retrieval/M approach/O for/O alignment/O ./O 
For/O each/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O segment/O ,/O the/O recognition/O output/O is/O converted/O into/O feature/O vectors/O ,/O where/O the/O weight/O of/O an/O indexing/O term/O -LRB-/O which/O can/O be/O a/O syllable/O ,/O a/O character/O ,/O a/O word/O ,/O or/O an/O overlapping/O N-gram/O combination/O -RRB-/O is/O represented/O as/O tf/O ×/O idf/O ,/O the/O term/O frequency/O multiplied/O by/O the/O inverse/O document/O frequency/O ./O 
Each/O anchor/O script/O is/O also/O represented/O by/O feature/O vectors/O in/O a/O similar/O way/O ./O 
The/O Cosine/M measure/M is/O used/O to/O estimate/O the/O relevance/O between/O the/O recognition/O output/O and/O the/O anchor/O script/O ./O 
The/O anchor/O script/O with/O the/O largest/O relevance/O value/O is/O aligned/O with/O the/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O segment/O ./O 
Details/O about/O the/O story/O segmentation/O approach/O and/O the/O information/O retrieval/O approach/O to/O story/O alignment/O can/O be/O found/O in/O Corpus/O Assessment/O A/O brief/O description/O Each/O one-hour/O news/O show/O usually/O has/O two/O or/O three/O parts/O separated/O by/O advertisements/O ./O 
Sometimes/O ,/O however/O ,/O there/O is/O no/O advertising/O at/O all/O within/O a/O show/O ./O 
Each/O part/O starts/O with/O headlines/O with/O background/O music/O ,/O followed/O by/O a/O number/O of/O stories/O ./O 
Because/O the/O news/O shows/O were/O collected/O from/O a/O non-profit/O public/O TV/O station/O ,/O the/O advertising/O was/O composed/O of/O public/O service/O announcements/O and/O previews/O rather/O than/O commercials/O ./O 
Generally/O ,/O a/O one-hour/O news/O show/O contains/O one/O to/O three/O headline/O sections/O ,/O zero/O to/O two/O advertising/O sections/O ,/O depending/O on/O the/O number/O of/O headline/O sections/O ,/O a/O number/O of/O news/O stories/O ,/O a/O weather/O forecast/O section/O ,/O and/O an/O ending/O section/O ./O 
Preliminary/O statistical/O analysis/O Some/O preliminary/O assessments/O of/O the/O 198-hour/O Mandarin/O Chinese/O broadcast/O news/O corpus/O have/O been/O conducted/O ./O 
There/O are/O seven/O distinct/O studio/O anchors/O ;/O three/O are/O male/O ,/O and/O four/O are/O female/O ./O 
The/O distribution/O of/O studio/O anchors/O is/O summarized/O in/O Figure/O 2/O ./O 
A/O partial/O transcription/O of/O a/O broadcast/O news/O show/O identified/O reporters/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O exact/O number/O of/O distinct/O field/O reporters/O may/O be/O much/O lower/O than/O 386/O but/O slightly/O higher/O than/O 100/O ./O 
-LRB-/O 2/O -RRB-/O There/O are/O around/O 5,900/O distinct/O interviewees/O ./O 
Of/O these/O ,/O around/O 4,000/O interviewees/O are/O male/O ./O 
It/O is/O interesting/O to/O find/O that/O ,/O unlike/O the/O situation/O with/O the/O field/O reporters/O ,/O the/O percentage/O for/O male/O speakers/O is/O relatively/O high/O ./O 
Moreover/O ,/O even/O though/O the/O identities/O of/O some/O interviewees/O are/O also/O unknown/O ,/O it/O is/O very/O likely/O that/O the/O unknown/O interviewees/O in/O different/O stories/O are/O in/O fact/O different/O people/O ./O 
-LRB-/O 3/O -RRB-/O The/O total/O lengths/O of/O the/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O ,/O field/O reporter/O speech/O ,/O and/O interviewee/O speech/O are/O around/O 27/O hours/O ,/O 71/O hours/O ,/O and/O 45/O hours/O ,/O respectively/O ./O 
The/O numbers/O of/O characters/O transcribed/O from/O them/O are/O around/O 493,000/O ,/O 1,167,000/O ,/O and/O 616,000/O ,/O respectively/O ./O 
The/O speaking/O rates/O are/O 4.9/O ,/O 5.1/O ,/O and/O 4.5/O syllables/O per/O second/O ,/O respectively/O ./O 
Some/O segments/O contain/O pure/O music/O or/O noise/O ./O 
In/O addition/O ,/O some/O speech/O segments/O contain/O foreign/O languages/O ,/O dialects/O ,/O or/O aboriginal/O languages/O ./O 
If/O these/O segments/O are/O omitted/O ,/O then/O the/O total/O lengths/O of/O the/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O ,/O field/O reporter/O speech/O ,/O and/O interviewee/O speech/O are/O around/O 25/O hours/O ,/O 58/O hours/O ,/O and/O 35/O hours/O ,/O respectively/O ./O 
Some/O speech/O segments/O contain/O overlapping/O speech/O ./O 
-LRB-/O 4/O -RRB-/O The/O frequency/O counts/O of/O the/O most/O frequently/O used/O tags/O in/O the/O corpus/O are/O shown/O in/O In/O addition/O to/O the/O 4,100/O news/O stories/O ,/O there/O are/O 581/O headline/O sections/O -LRB-/O ~/O 5.5/O hours/O -RRB-/O ,/O 652/O advertising/O sections/O -LRB-/O ~/O 23.5/O hours/O -RRB-/O ,/O 197/O weather/O forecast/O sections/O -LRB-/O ~/O 10.3/O hours/O -RRB-/O ,/O and/O 197/O ending/O sections/O -LRB-/O ~/O 0.8/O hours/O -RRB-/O ./O 
All/O the/O headline/O sections/O and/O ending/O sections/O were/O carefully/O transcribed/O ./O 
The/O weather/O forecasts/O in/O 10/O shows/O were/O also/O carefully/O transcribed/O ,/O but/O the/O remaining/O 187/O weather/O forecasts/O and/O all/O the/O advertising/O sections/O were/O simply/O annotated/O with/O time/O stamps/O without/O orthographic/O transcripts/O ./O 
The/O transcripts/O contain/O around/O 2.3/O million/O Chinese/O characters/O in/O total/O ./O 
Table/O 2/O ./O 
The/O frequency/O counts/O of/O the/O most/O frequently/O used/O tags/O in/O the/O corpus/O ./O 
Min-Nan/O is/O a/O common/O dialect/O and/O Formosan/O denotes/O all/O the/O aboriginal/O languages/O used/O in/O the/O Taiwan/O area/O Studio/O Corpus/O Webpage/O and/O Tool/O Though/O the/O project/O is/O finished/O ,/O we/O will/O continue/O to/O correct/O errors/O reported/O by/O users/O and/O post/O the/O most/O up-to-date/O versions/O of/O transcriptions/O on/O the/O corpus/O webpage/O ,/O http://sovideo.iis.sinica.edu.tw/SLG/corpus/MATBN-corpus.htm/O ./O 
Currently/O ,/O on/O this/O webpage/O ,/O two/O tools/O are/O available/O for/O querying/O the/O corpus/O ./O 
Speech/M Recognition/M Evaluation/M The/O development/O and/O evaluation/O sets/O Ten/O one-hour/O shows/O were/O selected/O from/O the/O 198-hour/O carefully/O transcribed/O broadcast/O news/O database/O to/O evaluate/O the/O speech/O recognition/O performance/O ./O 
That/O is/O ,/O we/O spot-checked/O about/O 5/O %/O -LRB-/O 10/198/O */O 100/O %/O =/O 5.05/O %/O -RRB-/O of/O the/O database/O ./O 
We/O divided/O the/O shows/O into/O a/O development/O set/O and/O an/O evaluation/O set/O ./O 
The/O development/O set/O consisted/O of/O five/O The/O NTNU/O broadcast/O news/O transcription/O system/O The/O NTNU/O broadcast/O news/O transcription/O system/O was/O employed/O here/O for/O speech/M recognition/M evaluation/M ./O 
Some/O features/O of/O the/O speech/O recognizer/O are/O reviewed/O below/O ./O 
Front-end/O signal/O processing/O In/O the/O speech/O recognizer/O ,/O spectral/M analysis/M is/O applied/O to/O a/O 20/O ms/O frame/O of/O speech/O waveform/O every/O 10/O ms./O For/O each/O speech/O frame/O ,/O 12/O mel-frequency/M cepstral/M coefficients/M -LRB-/O MFCCs/M -RRB-/O and/O the/O logarithmic/O energy/O are/O extracted/O ,/O and/O these/O coefficients/O and/O their/O first/O and/O second/O time/O derivatives/O are/O spliced/O together/O to/O form/O a/O 39-dimensional/O feature/O vector/O ./O 
In/O addition/O ,/O to/O compensate/O for/O channel/O noise/O ,/O utterance-based/O cepstral/O mean/O subtraction/O -LRB-/O CMS/M -RRB-/O is/O applied/O to/O the/O training/O and/O testing/O speech/O ./O 
Acoustic/M modeling/M The/O acoustic/O models/O were/O trained/O with/O a/O database/O of/O 16/O hours/O of/O broadcast/O news/O speech/O collected/O from/O several/O radio/O stations/O located/O in/O Taipei/O ./O 
The/O broadcast/O news/O data/O were/O recorded/O using/O a/O wizard/O FM/O radio/O connected/O to/O a/O PC/O and/O digitized/O at/O a/O sampling/O rate/O of/O 16/O kHz/O with/O 16/O bit/O resolution/O ./O 
The/O data/O collection/O period/O was/O from/O December/O 1998/O to/O July/O 1999/O ./O 
The/O training/O database/O is/O a/O combination/O of/O two/O corpora/O :/O The/O first/O corpus/O contains/O two/O hours/O of/O field/O reporter/O and/O interviewee/O speech/O ,/O and/O four/O hours/O of/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O ./O 
The/O manual/O transcripts/O have/O been/O time-aligned/O to/O the/O phrasal/O level/O ./O 
The/O second/O corpus/O contains/O ten/O hours/O of/O studio/O anchor/O speech/O ./O 
Each/O audio/O file/O is/O a/O short/O news/O abstract/O -LRB-/O lasting/O 50/O seconds/O on/O average/O -RRB-/O produced/O by/O a/O studio/O anchor/O ./O 
Unlike/O the/O first/O corpus/O ,/O only/O the/O orthographic/O transcripts/O were/O available/O for/O each/O audio/O file/O ;/O detailed/O time/O alignment/O was/O unavailable/O ./O 
Due/O to/O the/O monosyllabic/O structure/O of/O the/O Chinese/M language/M ,/O where/O each/O syllable/O can/O be/O decomposed/O into/O an/O INITIAL/O and/O a/O FINAL/O ,/O the/O acoustic/O units/O used/O in/O the/O speech/O recognizer/O are/O intra-syllable/O right-context-dependent/O INITIAL/FINALs/O ,/O including/O 112/O context-dependent/O INITIALs/O and/O 38/O context-independent/O FINALs/O ./O 
Each/O INITIAL/O or/O FINAL/O is/O represented/O by/O a/O Continuous/M Density/M Hidden/M Markov/M Model/M -LRB-/O CDHMM/O -RRB-/O with/O two/O to/O four/O states/O ./O 
The/O Gaussian/O mixture/O number/O per/O state/O ranges/O from/O 1/O to/O 64/O ,/O depending/O on/O the/O amount/O of/O corresponding/O training/O data/O available/O ./O 
In/O addition/O ,/O the/O silence/O model/O is/O a/O 1-state/O CDHMM/O with/O 128/O Gaussian/O mixtures/O trained/O with/O the/O non-speech/O segments/O ./O 
A/O total/O of/O 12,419/O mixtures/O were/O obtained/O ./O 
Lexicon/O and/O language/O modeling/O The/O lexicon/O contains/O 71,694/O words/O ,/O including/O 66,290/O words/O selected/O manually/O from/O the/O CKIP/O lexicon/O and/O 5,404/O new/O words/O or/O compound/O words/O extracted/O automatically/O from/O the/O language/O model/O training/O corpus/O ./O 
The/O word-based/O unigram/O ,/O bigram/O ,/O and/O trigram/M language/M models/M were/O trained/O using/O the/O newswire/O text/O corpus/O ,/O consisting/O of/O 170/O million/O Chinese/O characters/O collected/O from/O Central/M News/M Agency/M -LRB-/O CNA/M -RRB-/O in/O 2001/O and/O 2002/O -LRB-/O the/O Chinese/O Gigaword/O Corpus/O released/O by/O LDC/M -RRB-/O ./O 
The/O language/O models/O were/O further/O processed/O with/O Katz/O backoff/O smoothing/O The/O speech/O recognizer/O The/O speech/O recognizer/O was/O implemented/O with/O a/O left-to-right/O frame-synchronous/O tree/M search/O as/O well/O as/O a/O lexical/O prefix/O tree/O organization/O of/O the/O lexicon/O ./O 
At/O each/O speech/O frame/O ,/O the/O so-called/O word-conditioned/O method/O was/O used/O to/O group/O path/O hypotheses/O that/O shared/O the/O same/O history/O of/O predecessor/O words/O into/O the/O same/O copies/O of/O the/O lexical/O tree/O ,/O and/O to/O expand/O and/O recombine/O them/O according/O to/O the/O tree/O structure/O until/O a/O possible/O word/O ending/O was/O reached/O ./O 
At/O word/O boundaries/O ,/O the/O path/O hypotheses/O among/O the/O tree/O copies/O that/O had/O the/O same/O search/O history/O were/O recombined/O and/O then/O propagated/O to/O the/O existing/O tree/O copies/O or/O used/O to/O start/O new/O ones/O if/O none/O yet/O existed/O ./O 
At/O each/O speech/O frame/O ,/O a/O beam/O pruning/O technique/O ,/O which/O considered/O the/O decoding/O scores/O of/O path/O hypotheses/O together/O with/O their/O unigram/O language/O model/O look-ahead/O and/O syllable-level/O acoustic/O look-ahead/O scores/O ,/O was/O used/O to/O select/O the/O most/O promising/O path/O hypotheses/O ./O 
Moreover/O ,/O if/O the/O word/O hypotheses/O ending/O at/O each/O speech/O frame/O had/O scores/O that/O were/O higher/O than/O a/O predefined/O threshold/O ,/O then/O their/O associated/O decoding/O information/O ,/O such/O as/O the/O word/O start/O and/O end/O frames/O ,/O the/O identities/O of/O current/O and/O predecessor/O words/O ,/O and/O the/O acoustic/O score/O ,/O were/O kept/O in/O order/O to/O build/O a/O word/O graph/O for/O further/O language/O model/O rescoring/O ./O 
Once/O the/O word/O graph/O had/O been/O built/O ,/O the/O Viterbi/O beam/O search/O with/O higher/O language/O model/O weighting/O Speech/M recognition/M experiments/O We/O conducted/O speech/O recognition/O experiments/O on/O the/O development/O set/O and/O the/O evaluation/O set/O both/O separately/O and/O jointly/O ./O 
Discussion/O Notice/O that/O ,/O in/O a/O benchmark/O test/O ,/O the/O model/O parameters/O optimally/O tuned/O for/O the/O development/O set/O are/O applied/O to/O the/O evaluation/O set/O directly/O ./O 
Further/O tuning/O conducted/O on/O the/O evaluation/O set/O is/O not/O allowed/O ./O 
In/O this/O study/O ,/O we/O aimed/O to/O select/O development/O and/O evaluation/O data/O from/O the/O corpus/O so/O that/O users/O can/O experiment/O on/O it/O with/O the/O same/O setting/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O we/O have/O only/O reported/O the/O baseline/O recognition/O accuracy/O of/O the/O development/O set/O and/O evaluation/O set/O ./O 
Furthermore/O ,/O in/O this/O corpus/O ,/O it/O is/O obvious/O that/O most/O of/O the/O anchor/O reporters/O and/O field/O reporters/O are/O female/O ,/O while/O most/O of/O the/O interviewees/O are/O male/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O it/O is/O difficult/O to/O design/O a/O benchmark/O test/O with/O a/O balanced/O number/O of/O female/O and/O male/O speakers/O using/O different/O types/O of/O speech/O ./O 
However/O ,/O this/O may/O simply/O reflect/O the/O real/O situation/O in/O Taiwan/O ./O 
In/O that/O case/O ,/O we/O do/O not/O need/O to/O worry/O about/O the/O gender/O issue/O very/O much/O ./O 
Concluding/M Remarks/M Speech/M resources/O are/O crucially/O important/O for/O research/O and/O development/O in/O speech/O technology/O ./O 
But/O the/O development/O of/O a/O speech/O corpus/O used/O to/O be/O very/O tedious/O and/O time/O consuming/O ./O 
In/O August/O 2001/O ,/O we/O started/O a/O 3-year/O project/O aimed/O at/O collecting/O a/O Mandarin/O Chinese/O broadcast/O news/O corpus/O in/O Taiwan/O ./O 
At/O the/O end/O of/O the/O project/O ,/O we/O had/O labeled/O 198/O one-hour/O news/O shows/O using/O the/O DGA&LDC/O Transcriber/O ./O 
In/O this/O paper/O ,/O we/O have/O discussed/O the/O development/O and/O evaluation/O of/O the/O corpus/O ./O 
The/O speech/O corpus/O will/O soon/O be/O available/O through/O the/O Association/O for/O Computational/M Linguistics/M and/O Chinese/M Language/M Processing/M -LRB-/O ACLCLP/O -RRB-/O ./O 
In/O the/O future/O ,/O we/O will/O try/O to/O collect/O data/O from/O other/O TV/O broadcasters/O ./O 
We/O will/O also/O try/O to/O collect/O data/O from/O various/O programs/O ./O 
Appendix/O In/O the/O DGA&LDC/O Transcriber/O ,/O the/O annotation/O tags/O are/O divided/O into/O 4/O categories/O ,/O namely/O ,/O noise/O ,/O pronounce/O ,/O language/O ,/O and/O lexical/O ./O 
We/O list/O them/O in/O Table/O A1/O ./O

Conclusions/O In/O this/O paper/O ,/O we/O have/O presented/O a/O Chinese/M NER/M system/M ,/O called/O Mencius/O ./O 
We/O configured/O Mencius/O according/O to/O the/O following/O settings/O of/O to/O analyze/O the/O effects/O of/O using/O a/O Maximum/O Entropy-based/O Framework/O and/O a/O word/O segmentation/O module/O :/O -LRB-/O 1/O -RRB-/O Template-based/O with/O Char-based/M Tokenization/M -LRB-/O TC/M -RRB-/O ,/O -LRB-/O 2/O -RRB-/O Template-based/O with/O Word-based/M Tokenization/M -LRB-/O TW/M -RRB-/O ,/O -LRB-/O 3/O -RRB-/O Hybrid/O with/O Char-based/M Tokenization/M -LRB-/O HC/M -RRB-/O ,/O and/O -LRB-/O 4/O -RRB-/O Hybrid/O with/O Word-based/M Tokenization/M -LRB-/O HW/O -RRB-/O ./O

We/O will/O add/O these/O functions/O in/O the/O future/O ./O ''/O 
``/O Introduction/O With/O the/O evolution/O of/O human/O lives/O and/O the/O accelerated/O spread/O of/O information/O ,/O new/O words/O are/O created/O quickly/O as/O new/O things/O emerge/O every/O day/O ./O 
It/O is/O then/O necessary/O for/O natural/O language/O processing/O systems/O to/O identify/O and/O learn/O new/O words/O to/O progress/O with/O time/O ./O 
Chinese/O word/O segmentation/O systems/O ,/O for/O example/O ,/O typically/O utilize/O large/O dictionaries/O collected/O over/O a/O long/O period/O of/O time/O ./O 
No/O matter/O the/O size/O of/O the/O vocabulary/O for/O the/O dictionaries/O ,/O it/O is/O hardly/O possible/O for/O them/O to/O include/O all/O of/O the/O words/O or/O phrases/O that/O have/O been/O invented/O so/O far/O in/O the/O extensive/O knowledge/O domains/O ,/O not/O to/O mention/O to/O predict/O in/O advance/O new/O terms/O to/O appear/O in/O the/O future/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O it/O is/O more/O practical/O for/O Chinese/O word/O segmentation/O systems/O to/O use/O dynamic/O dictionaries/O that/O can/O be/O updated/O quickly/O and/O frequently/O with/O the/O new/O words/O found/O in/O the/O corpora/O of/O the/O desired/O domains/O ./O 
Hence/O ,/O unknown/O word/O extraction/O is/O actually/O essential/O for/O quite/O a/O few/O natural/O language/O processing/O systems/O ./O 
It/O is/O also/O useful/O for/O exploring/O hot/O or/O new/O terms/O for/O desired/O knowledge/O domains/O or/O internet/O communities/O ./O 
The/O approaches/O to/O unknown/O word/O extraction/O can/O be/O roughly/O divided/O into/O two/O categories/O ,/O rule-based/M approaches/M and/O statistical/O approaches/O ./O 
For/O rule-based/O approaches/O ,/O semantic/O rules/O for/O specific/O types/O of/O words/O ,/O such/O as/O the/O names/O of/O humans/O ,/O places/O ,/O and/O organizations/O ,/O normally/O are/O specially/O designed/O -LRB-/O Chinese/O Unknown/O Word/O Extraction/O approaches/O to/O combine/O the/O statistical/O features/O ./O 
Histogram/M equalization/M for/O statistical/O features/O was/O further/O introduced/O to/O compensate/O for/O the/O mismatch/O between/O the/O training/O and/O testing/O corpora/O that/O might/O come/O from/O the/O difference/O in/O corpus/O size/O or/O the/O change/O of/O the/O domain/O ./O

This/O scheme/O was/O first/O evaluated/O on/O SIGHAN2/O corpora/O for/O traditional/O Chinese/O provided/O by/O Chinese/M Knowledge/M Information/M Processing/M Group/M -LRB-/O CKIP/M -RRB-/O and/O City/O University/O of/O Hong/O Kong/O -LRB-/O CUHK/M -RRB-/O ./O 
When/O combing/O four/O heterogeneous/O statistical/O features/O ,/O DLG/M ,/O AV/O ,/O Link/O ,/O and/O PreC/O ,/O and/O applying/O histogram/O equalization/O for/O DLG/M ,/O the/O F-measures/O of/O 68.43/O %/O and/O 71.40/O %/O for/O within-domain/O CKIP/O corpus/O and/O cross-domain/O CUHK/O corpus/O ,/O respectively/O ,/O can/O be/O achieved/O ./O 
This/O scheme/O was/O finally/O used/O to/O explore/O unknown/O words/O in/O a/O novice/O domain/O of/O a/O news/O event/O ./O

Statistical/O Features/O Every/O sentence/O in/O a/O Chinese/O corpus/O contains/O a/O sequence/O of/O characters/O ./O 
If/O every/O combination/O of/O adjacent/O characters/O in/O a/O sentence/O must/O be/O considered/O as/O a/O word/O candidate/O ,/O there/O would/O be/O huge/O number/O of/O word/O candidates/O where/O a/O large/O portion/O would/O be/O redundant/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O every/O combination/O of/O adjacent/O characters/O ,/O denoted/O as/O ''/O ''/O character/O group/O ''/O ''/O in/O this/O paper/O ,/O needs/O to/O be/O screened/O first/O so/O the/O total/O number/O of/O word/O candidates/O can/O be/O reduced/O to/O a/O manageable/O size/O and/O the/O statistics/O could/O be/O computed/O ./O 
The/O occurrence/O count/O for/O each/O character/O group/O ,/O i.e./O the/O character/O n-gram/M ,/O is/O computed/O and/O used/O as/O one/O of/O the/O screening/O criteria/O ./O 
Those/O character/O groups/O with/O length/O less/O than/O eight/O and/O with/O occurrence/O count/O more/O than/O or/O equal/O to/O five/O are/O accepted/O as/O word/O candidates/O ./O 
For/O each/O word/O candidate/O ,/O the/O statistical/O features/O are/O computed/O as/O below/O ./O 
Logarithm/O of/O Character/O N-Gram/O -LRB-/O LogC/O -RRB-/O -LRB-/O -RRB-/O -LRB-/O -RRB-/O -LRB-/O -RRB-/O i/O i/O LogC/O T/O log/O C/O T/O =/O -LRB-/O 1/O -RRB-/O T/O i/O :/O the/O word/O candidate/O with/O index/O i./O C/O -LRB-/O T/O i/O -RRB-/O :/O the/O occurrence/O count/O for/O the/O word/O candidate/O T/O i/O ./O 
Since/O words/O tend/O to/O appear/O repeatedly/O in/O the/O corpora/O ,/O those/O word/O candidates/O with/O high/O occurrence/O count/O are/O more/O probable/O to/O be/O words/O ./O 
Nevertheless/O ,/O there/O are/O often/O quite/O a/O few/O false/O alarms/O when/O occurrence/O count/O is/O the/O only/O decision/O feature/O ./O

First/O ,/O the/O CKIP/M corpus/O was/O randomly/O and/O equally/O divided/O into/O two/O sets/O ,/O named/O as/O the/O CKIP_Train/O set/O for/O training/O and/O the/O CKIP_Test/O set/O for/O testing/O ,/O respectively/O ./O

If/O multiple/O decision/O features/O with/O complementary/O characteristics/O could/O be/O combined/O appropriately/O ,/O better/O performance/O could/O be/O obtained/O in/O general/O ./O 
In/O this/O paper/O ,/O a/O classifier/O based/O on/O multilayer/O perceptrons/O -LRB-/O MLP/M -RRB-/O is/O used/O for/O word/O verification/O ./O 
MLP/M is/O a/O machine/O learning/O approach/O based/O on/O nonlinear/O regression/O ./O 
In/O order/O to/O minimize/O the/O square/O errors/O ,/O the/O gradient/M descent/M algorithm/M is/O applied/O ,/O and/O the/O connection/O weights/O in/O the/O network/O are/O updated/O iteratively/O according/O to/O the/O errors/O propagated/O backwards/O till/O the/O estimation/O error/O converges/O ./O 
x/O y/O Threshold/O Test/O HEQ/MSW/O Selection/O F/O -LRB-/O ?/O -RRB-/O F/O -LRB-/O ?/O -RRB-/O F/O -LRB-/O ?/O -RRB-/O F/O -LRB-/O ?/O -RRB-/O F/O -LRB-/O ?/O -RRB-/O DLG/O Word/O Non-word/O Chinese/O Unknown/O Word/O Extraction/O Experiments/O and/O Analysis/O In/O this/O section/O ,/O the/O corpora/O CKIP_Train/O ,/O CKIP_Test/O ,/O and/O CUHK_Test/O ,/O as/O described/O in/O Section/O 3.1/O ,/O were/O used/O for/O experiments/O ./O

In/O addition/O ,/O the/O numbers/O of/O words/O for/O them/O are/O 33,429/O ,/O 33,661/O ,/O and/O 22,913/O ,/O respectively/O ,/O according/O to/O the/O sentences/O with/O word/O segmentation/O in/O every/O corpus/O ./O 
The/O segmentation/O results/O were/O used/O to/O label/O the/O ground/O truths/O for/O word/O verification/O ,/O i.e./O ,/O whether/O a/O candidate/O can/O be/O a/O word/O or/O not/O in/O general/O without/O considering/O its/O usage/O context/O ./O

The/O details/O of/O the/O experimental/O corpora/O are/O depicted/O in/O First/O ,/O the/O basic/O experiments/O of/O word/O verification/O were/O conducted/O using/O at/O least/O four/O types/O of/O features/O based/O on/O the/O architecture/O in/O Chinese/O Unknown/O Word/O Extraction/O Figure/O 4/O ./O

Note/O here/O that/O only/O the/O performance/O of/O HEQs/O for/O DLG/M is/O depicted/O because/O the/O other/O features/O are/O not/O helpful/O when/O integrated/O with/O HEQ/O in/O our/O auxiliary/O experiments/O ./O 
For/O Link/O and/O AV/O ,/O the/O histograms/O for/O the/O training/O and/O testing/O domains/O almost/O coincide/O such/O that/O it/O can/O hardly/O get/O benefits/O from/O equalization/O ,/O while/O the/O extra/O nonlinear/O transformation/O of/O the/O feature/O might/O degrade/O the/O performance/O ./O 
This/O is/O similar/O to/O the/O robustness/O issue/O ,/O where/O the/O robustness/O approaches/O for/O compensating/O for/O the/O mismatch/O between/O two/O environments/O usually/O incur/O the/O side/O effect/O of/O degrading/O the/O performance/O if/O the/O mismatch/O does/O not/O exist/O ./O 
In/O addition/O ,/O for/O PreC/O ,/O the/O histograms/O are/O very/O sparse/O and/O jerky/O with/O many/O zeros/O in/O bins/O ,/O since/O many/O word/O candidates/O might/O share/O the/O independence/O of/O a/O prefix/O character/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O it/O is/O not/O easy/O to/O model/O the/O cumulative/O distribution/O functions/O smoothly/O so/O HEQ/O can/O be/O well/O applied/O ,/O and/O the/O results/O are/O not/O shown/O here/O ./O 
Further/O ,/O the/O same/O experiments/O were/O conducted/O for/O cross-domain/O testing/O data/O ./O 
That/O is/O ,/O the/O CKIP_Train/O corpus/O was/O used/O for/O training/O while/O the/O CUHK_Test/O corpus/O was/O used/O for/O testing/O ./O 
The/O experimental/O results/O are/O shown/O in/O Performance/O improvements/O by/O MSW/HEQ/O for/O cross-domain/O test/O ./O 
The/O above/O results/O show/O that/O HEQ/M can/O compensate/O for/O the/O mismatch/O of/O the/O DLG/O feature/O between/O the/O training/O and/O testing/O domains/O effectively/O ,/O and/O the/O improvements/O achieved/O for/O cross-domain/O test/O and/O within-domain/O test/O are/O compatible/O ./O 
Besides/O ,/O HEQ/M can/O improve/O the/O performance/O more/O significantly/O than/O MSW/M ./O 
This/O is/O because/O ,/O the/O nonlinear/O equalization/O of/O HEQ/O works/O effectively/O even/O if/O the/O shapes/O of/O the/O distributions/O between/O different/O domains/O are/O quite/O different/O ,/O but/O the/O equalization/O of/O MSW/M by/O shifting/O or/O scaling/O can/O work/O well/O only/O when/O the/O distributions/O have/O close/O shapes/O ./O

The/O security/O analysis/O shows/O that/O our/O scheme/O satisfies/O the/O security/O requirements/O of/O I/O/O privacy/O and/O correctness/O ./O ''/O 
``/O Introduction/O Boolean/O functions/O play/O an/O important/O role/O in/O the/O design/O of/O symmetric/O key/O cryptographic/O algorithms/O ./O 
In/O case/O of/O block/O ciphers/O like/O AES/M and/O DES/M ,/O nonlinearity/O is/O provided/O by/O the/O substitution/O boxes/O -LRB-/O S-box/O -RRB-/O solely/O ./O

With/O the/O help/O of/O the/O victim/O 's/O upstream/O routers/O map/O ,/O it/O can/O uniquely/O identify/O any/O upstream/O edge/O formed/O by/O two/O adjacent/O routers/O on/O each/O path/O during/O attack/O paths/O reconstruction/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O proposed/O marking/O scheme/O is/O effective/O for/O tracing/O multiple/O attacks/O ./O 
Dean/O et/O al./O did/O not/O mention/O in/O 4.4/O Marking/M and/O Reconstruction/O Over/O -/O heads/O The/O packet/O marking/M algorithm/M as/O shown/O in/O Backward/O Compatibility/O Backward/O compatibility/O is/O an/O important/O issue/O concerning/O whether/O the/O proposed/O method/O can/O be/O put/O into/O practice/O ./O 
As/O our/O marking/O scheme/O involves/O writing/O some/O information/O to/O the/O IP/O header/O of/O a/O packet/O ,/O we/O should/O find/O out/O the/O maximum/O number/O of/O bits/O available/O in/O an/O IP/O header/O that/O can/O be/O used/O to/O store/O the/O markings/O ./O 
The/O total/O number/O of/O bits/O b/O needed/O to/O store/O the/O markings/O can/O be/O estimated/O by/O :/O log/O 2/O -LRB-/O p/O -RRB-/O +/O log/O 2/O -LRB-/O d/O -RRB-/O +/O log/O 2/O -LRB-/O n/O -RRB-/O ;/O the/O three/O terms/O estimate/O the/O bits/O to/O store/O Fullpath/O -LRB-/O a/O value/O less/O than/O p/O -RRB-/O ,/O distance/O ,/O and/O x/O respectively/O ./O 
In/O practice/O ,/O we/O can/O set/O c/O ,/O d/O ,/O p/O ,/O and/O n/O as/O follows/O :/O c/O =/O 4/O ,/O d/O =/O 32/O ,/O p/O =/O 257/O ,/O n/O =/O 2c/O =/O 8/O ./O 
Then/O the/O total/O number/O of/O bits/O b/O would/O be/O 17/O ./O 
The/O reason/O for/O setting/O n/O equal/O to/O 2c/O is/O that/O each/O Fullpath/O value/O is/O related/O to/O 2c/O fragments/O of/O two/O IP/O addresses/O ./O 
As/O long/O as/O there/O are/O 2c/O packets/O with/O distinct/O values/O of/O x/O ,/O the/O next/O hop/O router/O can/O be/O identified/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O 3/O bits/O have/O been/O used/O to/O represent/O 8/O distinct/O values/O of/O x/O ./O 
There/O is/O a/O tradeoff/O between/O the/O number/O of/O packets/O needed/O for/O paths/O reconstruction/O and/O the/O number/O of/O bits/O for/O the/O markings/O ,/O which/O depends/O partly/O on/O the/O number/O of/O IP/O address/O fragments/O ,/O c/O ./O 
A/O smaller/O c/O implies/O :/O i/O -RRB-/O fewer/O packets/O and/O a/O shorter/O time/O would/O be/O required/O for/O attack/O paths/O reconstruction/O ;/O ii/O -RRB-/O more/O bits/O would/O be/O needed/O since/O the/O value/O of/O each/O IP/O address/O fragment/O would/O be/O larger/O ./O 
Though/O the/O range/O of/O distinct/O values/O for/O x/O would/O be/O smaller/O ,/O the/O total/O number/O of/O bits/O needed/O would/O be/O larger/O ./O 
As/O the/O number/O of/O bits/O available/O in/O the/O IP/O header/O that/O can/O be/O used/O to/O store/O the/O markings/O is/O very/O limited/O ,/O we/O eclectically/O choose/O c/O equal/O to/O 4/O in/O our/O implementation/O ./O 
Since/O almost/O any/O packet/O can/O reach/O its/O destination/O through/O no/O more/O than/O 32/O hops/O Simulation/O Results/O We/O have/O performed/O a/O good/O number/O of/O simulation/O experiments/O to/O examine/O the/O feasibility/O and/O to/O assess/O the/O performance/O of/O our/O marking/O scheme/O ./O 
The/O primary/O objective/O of/O the/O experiments/O is/O to/O examine/O the/O following/O parameters/O related/O to/O the/O performance/O of/O the/O marking/O scheme/O :/O the/O number/O of/O false/O positives/O ,/O the/O minimum/O number/O of/O packets/O needed/O for/O reconstruction/O ,/O the/O reconstruction/O time/O ,/O etc./O ./O 
We/O prepare/O for/O the/O simulation/O experiments/O an/O upstream/O routers/O map/O with/O over/O 2000/O routers/O ./O 
The/O routers/O are/O assigned/O some/O real/O IP/O addresses/O obtained/O from/O the/O Internet/O by/O using/O the/O traceroute/O technique/O ./O 
The/O attack/O paths/O are/O randomly/O chosen/O from/O the/O paths/O in/O the/O map/O ;/O and/O different/O numbers/O of/O packets/O are/O generated/O and/O transmitted/O along/O each/O of/O these/O paths/O respectively/O ./O 
Each/O router/O simulates/O marking/O any/O packets/O it/O receives/O ,/O according/O to/O our/O packet/O marking/M algorithm/M ./O 
After/O collecting/O sufficient/O number/O of/O marked/O packets/O ,/O the/O victim/O simulates/O reconstructing/O the/O attack/O paths/O according/O to/O our/O proposed/O reconstruction/M algorithm/M ./O 
The/O experiment/O results/O show/O that/O the/O proposed/O marking/O scheme/O is/O feasible/O and/O the/O performance/O is/O satis/O -/O factory/O ./O 
Figures/O 8/O and/O 9/O present/O two/O plots/O showing/O the/O minimum/O number/O of/O packets/O ,/O required/O for/O reconstruction/O ,/O sent/O by/O the/O attacker/O along/O any/O single/O path/O for/O two/O different/O marking/O probabilities/O 4/O %/O and/O 1/O %/O respectively/O ,/O assuming/O the/O reconstruction/O success/O probability/O being/O 95/O %/O ./O 
As/O expected/O ,/O with/O a/O smaller/O marking/O probability/O q/O ,/O more/O packets/O would/O be/O needed/O for/O attack/O paths/O reconstruction/O ./O 
Each/O data/O point/O in/O each/O of/O the/O plots/O corresponds/O to/O an/O average/O of/O the/O data/O values/O obtained/O from/O over/O 300/O independent/O experiments/O for/O a/O certain/O path/O length/O ./O 
The/O experiment/O results/O on/O the/O minimum/O number/O of/O packets/O needed/O for/O paths/O reconstruction/O have/O been/O compared/O with/O those/O presented/O in/O FMS/O Conclusion/O The/O algebraic/O marking/O scheme/O proposed/O in/O this/O paper/O simplifies/O and/O improves/O on/O the/O algebraic/O marking/O scheme/O proposed/O by/O Dean/O et/O al./O ./O ''/O 
``/O Introduction/O Digital/O watermarking/O has/O been/O widely/O used/O to/O protect/O the/O copyright/O of/O digital/O images/O ./O 
In/O order/O to/O strengthen/O the/O intellectual/O property/O right/O of/O a/O digital/O image/O ,/O a/O trademark/O of/O the/O owner/O could/O be/O selected/O as/O a/O watermark/O and/O embedded/O into/O the/O protected/O image/O ./O 
The/O image/O that/O embedded/O the/O watermark/O is/O called/O a/O watermarked/O image/O ./O 
Then/O the/O watermarked/O image/O could/O be/O published/O ,/O and/O the/O owner/O can/O prove/O the/O ownership/O of/O a/O suspected/O image/O by/O retrieving/O the/O watermark/O from/O the/O watermarked/O image/O ./O 
According/O to/O the/O retrieved/O results/O ,/O we/O can/O determine/O the/O ownership/O of/O the/O suspected/O image/O ./O 
Generally/O ,/O a/O practical/O and/O useful/O watermarking/O scheme/O has/O to/O meet/O the/O following/O require/O -/O ments/O 2/O -RRB-/O Imperceptibility/O :/O A/O watermark/O can/O be/O embedded/O into/O an/O image/O as/O either/O visible/O or/O invisible/O ./O 
The/O visible/O watermark/O is/O perceptible/O and/O is/O just/O like/O noise/O ./O 
It/O mostly/O can/O be/O removed/O by/O a/O noise/O removing/O process/O ./O 
In/O order/O to/O decrease/O the/O risk/O of/O cracking/O ,/O most/O of/O the/O proposed/O watermarking/O schemes/O are/O invisible/O ./O 
On/O the/O other/O hand/O ,/O the/O quality/O of/O the/O watermarked/O image/O is/O also/O important/O ./O 
If/O the/O watermark/O embedding/O process/O seriously/O affects/O the/O quality/O of/O the/O watermarked/O image/O ,/O the/O watermarked/O image/O will/O draw/O the/O attention/O of/O attackers/O or/O even/O lose/O its/O value/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O quality/O between/O the/O original/O image/O and/O the/O watermarked/O image/O should/O not/O be/O seriously/O degraded/O ./O 
The/O property/O is/O called/O imperceptibility/O ./O 
3/O -RRB-/O Readily/O Embedding/O and/O Retrieving/O :/O The/O watermark/O must/O be/O able/O to/O be/O easily/O and/O securely/O embedded/O and/O retrieved/O by/O the/O owner/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O overheads/O of/O embedding/O process/O and/O retrieving/O In/O recent/O years/O a/O special/O kind/O of/O digital/O watermarking/O is/O discussed/O widely/O ,/O called/O reversible/O watermarking/O ./O 
It/O not/O only/O provides/O the/O protection/O of/O the/O copyright/O by/O embedding/O the/O assigned/O watermark/O into/O the/O original/O image/O but/O also/O can/O recover/O the/O original/O image/O from/O the/O suspected/O image/O ./O 
The/O retrieved/O watermark/O can/O be/O used/O to/O determine/O the/O ownership/O by/O comparing/O the/O retrieved/O watermark/O with/O the/O assigned/O one/O ./O 
Similar/O to/O conventional/O watermarking/O schemes/O ,/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O have/O to/O be/O robust/O against/O the/O intentional/O or/O the/O unintentional/O attacks/O ,/O and/O should/O be/O imperceptible/O to/O avoid/O the/O attraction/O of/O attacks/O and/O value/O lost/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O reversible/O watermarking/O also/O has/O to/O satisfy/O all/O requirements/O of/O the/O conventional/O watermarking/O such/O as/O robustness/O ,/O imperceptibility/O ,/O and/O readily/O embedding/O and/O retrieving/O ./O 
Except/O for/O these/O requirements/O ,/O reversible/O watermarking/O has/O to/O grantify/O the/O following/O two/O additional/O requirements/O ./O 
1/O -RRB-/O Blind/O :/O Some/O of/O the/O conventional/O watermarking/O schemes/O require/O the/O help/O of/O an/O original/O image/O to/O retrieve/O the/O embedded/O watermark/O ./O 
However/O ,/O the/O reversible/O watermarking/O can/O recover/O the/O original/O image/O from/O the/O watermarked/O image/O directly/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O reversible/O watermarking/O is/O blind/O ,/O which/O means/O the/O retrieval/O process/O does/O not/O need/O the/O original/O image/O ./O 
2/O -RRB-/O Higher/O Embedding/O Capacity/O :/O The/O capable/O size/O of/O embedding/O information/O is/O defined/O as/O the/O embedding/O capacity/O ./O 
Due/O to/O the/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O having/O to/O embed/O the/O recovery/O information/O and/O watermark/O information/O into/O the/O original/O image/O ,/O the/O required/O embedding/O capacity/O of/O the/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O is/O much/O more/O than/O the/O conventional/O watermarking/O schemes/O ./O 
The/O embedding/O capacity/O should/O not/O be/O extremely/O low/O to/O affect/O the/O accuracy/O of/O the/O retrieved/O watermark/O and/O the/O recovered/O image/O ./O 
The/O procedure/O of/O conventional/O and/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O can/O be/O illustrated/O by/O using/O the/O flowcharts/O in/O 1/O -RRB-/O The/O schemes/O by/O applying/O data/O compression/O ,/O such/O as/O 2/O -RRB-/O The/O schemes/O by/O using/O difference/O expansion/O ,/O such/O as/O 3/O -RRB-/O The/O schemes/O by/O using/O histogram/O bin/O exchanging/O ,/O such/O as/O The/O detailed/O descriptions/O of/O the/O three/O types/O are/O introduced/O in/O Sections/O 2/O ,/O 3/O ,/O and/O 4/O ,/O respectively/O ./O 
The/O features/O and/O comparisons/O are/O analyzed/O in/O Section/O 5/O ./O 
Some/O research/O issues/O are/O discussed/O in/O Section/O 6/O ,/O and/O the/O conclusions/O are/O in/O Section/O 7/O ./O 
Reversible/O Watermarking/O Schemes/O by/O Applying/O Data/O Compression/O In/O order/O to/O recover/O the/O original/O image/O from/O the/O watermarked/O image/O ,/O an/O intuitional/O strategy/O is/O to/O embed/O the/O recovery/O information/O into/O the/O original/O image/O ./O 
Except/O for/O the/O recovery/O information/O ,/O we/O also/O have/O to/O embed/O the/O data/O of/O watermark/O into/O the/O original/O image/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O capacity/O of/O the/O embedded/O information/O is/O much/O more/O than/O the/O conventional/O watermarking/O schemes/O ./O 
In/O order/O to/O embed/O more/O data/O into/O the/O original/O image/O ,/O a/O straight/O solution/O is/O to/O compress/O the/O embedding/O data/O ./O 
There/O are/O several/O watermarking/O schemes/O 1/O -RRB-/O Every/O pixel/O is/O quantified/O by/O using/O the/O following/O Llevel/O scalar/O quantization/O ,/O and/O the/O corresponding/O remainders/O are/O generated/O :/O Q/O L/O -LRB-/O x/O -RRB-/O =/O L/O ×/O x/O L/O ./O 
For/O example/O ,/O allow/O the/O 4/O ×/O 4/O block/O of/O original/O image/O be/O H/O =/O 3/O -RRB-/O To/O concatenate/O the/O L-ary/O converted/O watermark/O information/O after/O the/O compressed/O remainders/O ./O 
For/O the/O same/O example/O ,/O watermark/O W/O is/O converted/O from/O -LCB-/O 10 0010 1011/O -RCB-/O 2/O to/O -LCB-/O 4/O 2/O 1/O 0/O -RCB-/O 5/O ,/O and/O becomes/O -LCB-/O x/O 0/O ,/O x/O 1/O ,/O .../O ,/O x/O 11/O ,/O 4/O ,/O 2/O ,/O 1/O ,/O 0/O -RCB-/O ./O 
4/O -RRB-/O The/O watermarked/O image/O is/O generated/O by/O adding/O the/O compressed/O data/O and/O the/O watermark/O to/O the/O quantified/O image/O ./O 
Finally/O ,/O we/O gain/O the/O watermarked/O image/O In/O the/O retrieving/O and/O recovering/O process/O ,/O the/O first/O step/O of/O embedding/O process/O is/O applied/O again/O in/O the/O suspected/O image/O ./O 
The/O first/O twelve/O digits/O of/O the/O remainders/O can/O be/O decompressed/O to/O the/O 16/O original/O remainders/O and/O the/O last/O four/O bits/O is/O the/O hidden/O watermark/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O watermark/O can/O be/O retrieved/O to/O verify/O the/O ownership/O and/O the/O original/O image/O can/O be/O recovered/O ./O 
The/O processes/O of/O this/O scheme/O is/O shown/O in/O Reversible/O Watermarking/O Schemes/O by/O Using/O Difference/O Expansion/O The/O second/O type/O of/O reversible/O schemes/O is/O using/O difference/O expansion/O to/O embed/O information/O ./O 
So/O far/O ,/O several/O schemes/O l/O =/O -LRB-/O x/O +/O y/O -RRB-/O 2/O ,/O -LRB-/O 1/O -RRB-/O where/O x/O and/O y/O are/O two/O adjacent/O pixels/O ./O 
The/O inverse/O integer/O transformation/O can/O be/O represented/O as/O x/O =/O l/O +/O -LRB-/O h/O +/O 1/O -RRB-/O 2/O ,/O and/O -LRB-/O 2/O -RRB-/O y/O =/O l/O ?/O h/O 2/O ,/O -LRB-/O 3/O -RRB-/O where/O h/O =/O x/O ?/O y./O -LRB-/O 4/O -RRB-/O The/O processes/O of/O Tian/O 's/O scheme/O are/O described/O as/O follows/O ./O 
1/O -RRB-/O Calculating/O l/O i/O and/O h/O i/O for/O the/O i-th/O pair/O of/O pixels/O ,/O denoted/O as/O -LCB-/O x/O i/O ,/O y/O i/O -RCB-/O ,/O by/O using/O Equations/O 1/O and/O 4/O ./O 
Using/O the/O same/O example/O in/O the/O above/O ./O 
If/O w/O 0/O =/O -LCB-/O 0/O -RCB-/O 2/O ,/O then/O h/O 0/O =/O 6/O ×/O 2/O +/O 0/O =/O 12/O ./O 
If/O w/O 0/O =/O -LCB-/O 1/O -RCB-/O 2/O ,/O then/O h/O 0/O =/O 6/O ×/O 2/O +/O 1/O =/O 13/O ./O 
3/O -RRB-/O The/O parameters/O l/O i/O and/O h/O i/O are/O used/O to/O substitute/O for/O the/O parameter/O l/O i/O and/O h/O i/O in/O Equations/O 2/O and/O 3/O to/O get/O x/O i/O and/O y/O i/O ./O 
Continuity/O ,/O if/O the/O embedded/O bit/O of/O watermark/O is/O 1/O ,/O then/O x/O 0/O =/O l/O 0/O +/O -LRB-/O h/O 0/O +1/O -RRB-/O 2/O =/O 103/O +/O -LRB-/O 13/O +1/O -RRB-/O 2/O =/O 110/O and/O y/O 0/O =/O l/O 0/O ?/O h/O 0/O 2/O =/O 103/O ?/O 13/O 2/O =/O 97/O ./O 
Similarly/O ,/O if/O the/O embedded/O bit/O of/O watermark/O is/O 0/O ,/O then/O x/O 0/O =/O l/O 0/O +/O -LRB-/O h/O 0/O +1/O -RRB-/O 2/O =/O 103/O +/O -LRB-/O 12/O +1/O -RRB-/O 2/O =/O 109/O and/O y/O 0/O =/O l/O 0/O ?/O h/O 0/O 2/O =/O 103/O ?/O 12/O 2/O =/O 97/O ./O 
4/O -RRB-/O Repeat/O the/O former/O steps/O until/O all/O pixel/O pairs/O are/O pro-/O cessed/O ./O 
5/O -RRB-/O The/O watermarked/O image/O can/O be/O constructed/O by/O using/O each/O x/O i/O and/O y/O i/O ./O 
In/O Tian/O 's/O scheme/O ,/O h/O represents/O the/O generated/O feature/O of/O the/O original/O image/O and/O it/O is/O expanded/O to/O embed/O information/O ./O 
The/O flowcharts/O of/O Tian/O 's/O scheme/O is/O illustrated/O in/O -LRB-/O x/O 0/O +/O y/O 0/O -RRB-/O 2/O =/O -LRB-/O 110/O +97/O -RRB-/O 2/O =/O 103/O and/O h/O 0/O =/O x/O 0/O ?/O y/O 0/O =/O Reversible/O Watermarking/O Schemes/O by/O Using/O Histogram/O Bin/O Shifting/O The/O former/O two/O types/O of/O reversible/O watermarking/O are/O not/O robust/O under/O image/O processing/O and/O distortions/O ./O 
In/O order/O to/O enhance/O the/O robustness/O of/O the/O reversible/O watermarking/O ,/O the/O embedding/O target/O is/O replaced/O by/O the/O histogram/O of/O a/O block/O ./O 
There/O are/O several/O schemes/O 1/O -RRB-/O For/O each/O block/O B/O ,/O we/O randomly/O separate/O B/O into/O two/O zones/O Z/O a/O and/O Z/O b/O ,/O and/O calculate/O the/O two/O corresponding/O histograms/O of/O pixel/O values/O ,/O H/O a/O and/O H/O b/O ./O 
For/O example/O ,/O 2/O -RRB-/O If/O the/O corresponding/O bit/O of/O watermark/O is/O 1/O ,/O we/O downgrade/O every/O bin/O in/O H/O b/O except/O in/O shifting/O the/O lowest/O bin/O to/O the/O highest/O one/O ./O 
If/O the/O corresponding/O bit/O of/O watermark/O is/O 0/O ,/O we/O upgrade/O the/O bins/O except/O in/O shifting/O the/O highest/O to/O the/O lowest/O one/O ./O 
The/O embedded/O results/O are/O shown/O in/O 3/O -RRB-/O Repeat/O the/O former/O steps/O until/O all/O blocks/O are/O processed/O ./O 
From/O the/O characteristics/O of/O the/O images/O ,/O the/O neighboring/O pixels/O are/O usually/O similar/O to/O each/O other/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O H/O a/O and/O H/O b/O should/O also/O be/O similar/O for/O most/O of/O the/O image/O blocks/O ./O 
In/O normal/O cases/O ,/O it/O is/O assumed/O that/O the/O peak/O bin/O of/O Z/O a/O and/O Z/O b/O are/O the/O same/O ./O 
In/O cases/O in/O which/O the/O highest/O and/O lowest/O bins/O are/O shifted/O to/O the/O other/O side/O may/O cause/O a/O huge/O distortion/O ./O 
For/O example/O ,/O the/O white/O background/O may/O become/O black/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O Vleeschouwer/O et/O al./O ./O 
Discussions/O In/O this/O section/O ,/O we/O discuss/O the/O properties/O of/O the/O three/O types/O of/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O ./O 
Usually/O ,/O higher/O embedding/O capacity/O usually/O comes/O along/O with/O a/O higher/O distortion/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O based/O on/O the/O watermarked/O images/O with/O the/O similar/O image/O quality/O ,/O we/O compare/O the/O embedding/O capacity/O with/O the/O three/O types/O by/O using/O the/O three/O standard/O test/O images/O ,/O ''/O ''/O F-16/O ''/O ''/O ,/O ''/O ''/O Mandrill/O ''/O ''/O ,/O and/O ''/O ''/O Lena/O ''/O ''/O ,/O as/O shown/O in/O Research/O Issues/O It/O is/O clear/O from/O the/O comparisons/O in/O Section/O 5/O that/O the/O embedding/O capacity/O and/O the/O robustness/O are/O the/O two/O major/O challenges/O of/O reversible/O watermarking/O ./O 
Furthermore/O ,/O many/O of/O the/O conventional/O watermarking/O schemes/O are/O embedding/O watermarks/O in/O frequency/O domains/O ./O 
In/O general/O ,/O the/O advantages/O of/O embedding/O watermarks/O in/O frequency/O domains/O are/O naturally/O resisting/O some/O attacks/O ,/O immuned/O to/O several/O destruction/O ,/O or/O others/O ./O 
But/O the/O existing/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O did/O not/O fully/O utilize/O the/O advantages/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O we/O provide/O the/O following/O three/O research/O issues/O ./O 
1/O -RRB-/O Providing/O a/O higher/O embedding/O capacity/O ./O 
Although/O capacity/O is/O indeed/O not/O the/O necessary/O requirement/O of/O watermarking/O schemes/O ,/O but/O higher/O capacity/O is/O one/O of/O the/O ultimate/O goals/O ./O 
There/O 's/O still/O room/O for/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O to/O improve/O this/O terminology/O ./O 
2/O -RRB-/O Providing/O a/O higher/O robustness/O ./O 
The/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O using/O histogram/O bin/O shifting/O can/O resist/O several/O attacks/O ,/O but/O -LRB-/O a/O -RRB-/O F-16/O -LRB-/O b/O -RRB-/O Mandrill/O -LRB-/O c/O -RRB-/O Lena/O 3/O -RRB-/O Use/O the/O advantage/O of/O frequency/O domains/O ./O

Conclusions/O In/O this/O paper/O ,/O the/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O are/O defined/O and/O introduced/O ./O 
In/O order/O to/O work/O out/O the/O features/O of/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O ,/O we/O particularly/O classified/O the/O existing/O reversible/O watermarking/O schemes/O into/O three/O types/O ./O 
They/O are/O the/O schemes/O which/O apply/O data/O compression/O ,/O by/O using/O difference/O expansion/O ,/O and/O the/O schemes/O by/O using/O histogram/O bin/O shifting/O ./O

C6/O ./O

1/O -RRB-/O Setup/O -LRB-/O K/O -RRB-/O :/O The/O security/O parameter/O K/O is/O input/O ,/O mk/O 0/O is/O chosen/O from/O Z/O q/O ,/O two/O bilinear/O groups/O G/O 1/O ,/O G/O 2/O of/O order/O p/O ,/O and/O a/O bilinear/O map/O e/O :/O G/O 1/O ×/O G/O 1/O ?/O ?/O G/O 2/O are/O chosen/O by/O the/O root/O authority/O ./O

Communication/O between/O ants/O is/O based/O on/O a/O chemical/O substance/O called/O pheromone/O ./O

Though/O source/O IP/O addresses/O can/O be/O spoofed/O by/O attackers/O ,/O the/O paths/O packets/O take/O to/O the/O destination/O are/O totally/O decided/O by/O the/O network/O topology/O and/O routers/O in/O the/O Internet/O ,/O which/O are/O not/O controllable/O by/O the/O attackers/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O the/O path/O of/O a/O packet/O has/O taken/O can/O really/O show/O the/O source/O of/O it/O ./O 
By/O recording/O the/O path/O information/O ,/O the/O packets/O from/O different/O sources/O can/O be/O precisely/O differentiated/O ,/O no/O matter/O what/O the/O IP/O addresses/O appeared/O in/O the/O packets/O ./O 
Packet/O marking/O ,/O which/O is/O firstly/O proposed/O by/O Computing/O the/O Packet/O Marking/O The/O mark/O made/O by/O a/O router/O would/O be/O a/O function/O of/O its/O IP/O address/O ./O 
To/O fit/O the/O 32-bit/O IP/O address/O A/O of/O a/O router/O into/O the/O ID/O field/O ,/O we/O employ/O a/O hash/O function/O h/O that/O converts/O A/O to/O a/O 16-bit/O value/O ./O 
We/O adopt/O the/O CRC-16/M hash/M function/M which/O is/O easy/O to/O compute/O and/O has/O low/O collision/O rate/O ./O

We/O can/O not/O expect/O every/O router/O in/O the/O Internet/O to/O participate/O in/O the/O marking/O scheme/O and/O mark/O all/O packets/O passing/O through/O it/O ./O

In/O general/O ,/O our/O MDADF/O scheme/O has/O the/O following/O func/O -/O tions/O :/O @BULLET/O Distinguish/O and/O filter/O out/O spoofed/O packets/O by/O checking/O the/O marking/O of/O each/O packet/O using/O the/O Filter/O Pushback/O Implementation/O By/O employing/O the/O filtering/O scheme/O ,/O the/O firewall/O can/O protect/O the/O victim/O Web/O site/O by/O filtering/O out/O attack/O packets/O ./O

Good/O Packets/O Bad/O Packets/O Attack/O Detection/O Time/O Under/O our/O simulation/O setting/O ,/O the/O MDADF/O scheme/O detected/O the/O occurrence/O of/O an/O attack/O in/O 3/O -4/O seconds/O in/O most/O conditions/O as/O shown/O in/O Marking/O Scheme/O In/O the/O Pi/O scheme/O ,/O the/O ID/O field/O of/O each/O packet/O is/O divided/O into/O 16/n/O parts/O ,/O and/O each/O router/O inserts/O n/O bits/O of/O marking/O into/O the/O packet/O ./O

Filtering/O Scheme/O To/O filter/O packets/O ,/O the/O Pi/O scheme/O needs/O to/O be/O informed/O about/O the/O attack/O packet/O first/O ,/O learns/O its/O marking/O ,/O then/O begins/O to/O block/O packets/O with/O the/O same/O marking/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O it/O needs/O to/O store/O the/O attack/O markings/O ./O 
When/O the/O number/O of/O attackers/O is/O large/O ,/O lots/O of/O markings/O will/O be/O blocked/O ,/O then/O it/O is/O quite/O possible/O for/O legitimate/O packets/O to/O have/O the/O same/O markings/O and/O be/O dropped/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O to/O decrease/O the/O false/O positive/O ,/O a/O threshold/O can/O be/O applied/O so/O that/O a/O packet/O will/O be/O dropped/O only/O when/O the/O percentage/O of/O attack/O packets/O having/O the/O same/O marking/O exceeds/O the/O threshold/O ./O 
In/O the/O MDADF/O scheme/O ,/O the/O genuine/O -LRB-/O IP-address/O ,/O marking/O -RRB-/O pairs/O are/O stored/O ./O 
The/O packets/O with/O mis-matching/O markings/O are/O considered/O as/O spoofed/O packets/O from/O attackers/O and/O dropped/O ./O

Furthermore/O ,/O the/O markings/O of/O packets/O with/O unknown/O IP/O addresses/O will/O be/O verified/O through/O a/O marking/M verification/M process/O ,/O as/O well/O as/O those/O stored/O IP/O addresses/O from/O which/O many/O packets/O with/O different/O markings/O have/O been/O received/O ./O 
Both/O of/O the/O two/O schemes/O filter/O packets/O basing/O on/O the/O marking/O of/O packets/O ./O 
They/O do/O not/O use/O the/O marking/O to/O find/O the/O source/O of/O attack/O ,/O but/O use/O it/O to/O separate/O attack/O packets/O ./O 
Then/O ,/O the/O victim/O do/O not/O need/O to/O wait/O until/O enough/O packets/O have/O been/O received/O to/O reconstruct/O the/O path/O as/O the/O traceback/O mechanisms/O do/O ./O 
Therefore/O ,/O these/O two/O mechanisms/O have/O low/O overhead/O to/O both/O the/O routers/O and/O the/O victim/O ./O 
Both/O mechanisms/O can/O be/O combined/O with/O pushback/O ./O 
The/O Pi/O scheme/O filters/O packets/O basing/O on/O known/O attack/O markings/O ./O 
A/O disadvantage/O of/O it/O is/O that/O ,/O if/O an/O attacker/O spoofs/O the/O marking/O or/O inserts/O random/O value/O and/O the/O marking/O is/O not/O overwritten/O by/O other/O routers/O ,/O the/O victim/O can/O not/O recognize/O the/O attack/O packet/O ./O 
While/O the/O MDADF/M filtering/M scheme/O use/O genuine/O markings/O of/O IP/O addresses/O ,/O the/O packets/O with/O mis-matching/O markings/O are/O dropped/O ./O 
Even/O if/O no/O router/O marks/O the/O attack/O packet/O ,/O the/O genuine/O marking/O can/O not/O be/O spoofed/O by/O attackers/O in/O our/O marking/O scheme/O ,/O because/O each/O router/O 's/O marking/O is/O a/O function/O of/O its/O own/O secret/O key/O ,/O which/O is/O not/O available/O to/O attackers/O ./O

One/O side-benefit/O is/O to/O reveal/O differences/O between/O certificates/O used/O by/O fraudulent/O and/O legitimate/popular/O domains/O ./O 
In/O total/O ,/O we/O identified/O 9/O relevant/O certificate/O features/O ,/O listed/O in/O Analysis/O of/O Certificate/O Boolean/O Features/O ``/O Features/O F1-F4/O have/O boolean/O values/O ,/O e.g./O ,/O F1/O -LRB-/O md5/O -RRB-/O is/O true/O if/O the/O signature/O algorithm/O used/O in/O the/O certificate/O is/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O md5WithRSAEncryption/O ./O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O 
The/O results/O of/O analyzing/O these/O features/O are/O summarized/O in/O ''/O F1/O -LRB-/O md5/O -RRB-/O ''/O 9.9/O %/O of/O Alexa/O certificates/O use/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O md5WithRSAEnc/O ryption/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ,/O much/O less/O than/O those/O in/O *.com/*.net/O -LRB-/O 27.4/O %/O -RRB-/O ,/O Phishing/M -LRB-/O 17.4/O %/O -RRB-/O and/O Typosquatting/O -LRB-/O 26.1/O %/O -RRB-/O ./O 
Note/O that/O rogue/O certificates/O can/O be/O constructed/O using/O MD5/O -LRB-/O ''/O F2/O -LRB-/O bogus/O subject/O -RRB-/O ``/O A/O bogus/O subject/O indicates/O whether/O the/O subject/O fields/O have/O some/O bogus/O values/O -LRB-/O e.g./O ,/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ST/O =/O somestate/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ,/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O O/O =/O someorganization/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ,/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O CN/O =/O localhost/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ,/O .../O -RRB-/O ./O 
We/O identified/O a/O list/O of/O such/O meaningless/O values/O and/O considered/O subjects/O to/O be/O bogus/O if/O they/O contain/O one/O of/O these/O 15.8/O %/O of/O Alexa/O certificates/O are/O self-signed/O ,/O somehow/O unexpectedly/O ./O 
One/O possible/O explanation/O is/O that/O some/O of/O the/O popular/O domains/O in/O the/O Alexa/O set/O represent/O companies/O having/O their/O own/O CA/O and/O issuing/O their/O own/O certificates/O -LRB-/O e.g./O ,/O google/O ,/O microsoft/O ,/O yahoo/O .../O etc./O -RRB-/O ./O 
The/O percentages/O of/O self-signed/O certificates/O in/O *.com/*.net/O ,/O Phishing/M ,/O and/O Typosquatting/M is/O higher/O -LRB-/O resp./O ,/O 35.4/O %/O ,/O 30.6/O %/O and/O 53.5/O %/O -RRB-/O ./O 
This/O is/O expected/O for/O Phishing/O ,/O since/O miscreants/O would/O like/O to/O avoid/O leaving/O any/O trace/O by/O obtaining/O a/O certificate/O from/O a/O CA/M -LRB-/O which/O requires/O documentation/O and/O a/O payment/O -RRB-/O ./O 
For/O *.com/*.net/O ,/O a/O higher/O percentage/O could/O be/O explained/O by/O the/O use/O of/O locally/O generated/O certificates/O ,/O e.g./O ,/O using/O OpenSSL/O ''/O F4/O -LRB-/O host-common-name-sim/O -RRB-/O ``/O We/O expect/O the/O common/O name/O in/O the/O subject/O field/O to/O be/O very/O similar/O to/O the/O hostname/O in/O popular/O domain/O certificates/O ,/O while/O we/O intuitively/O expect/O this/O to/O be/O lower/O in/O malicious/O domain/O certificates/O ,/O e.g./O ,/O because/O malicious/O domains/O may/O not/O use/O complying/O SSL/O certificates/O ./O 
In/O order/O to/O assess/O this/O ,/O we/O define/O a/O feature/O called/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O host-common-name/O sim/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ./O 
This/O feature/O measures/O the/O similarity/O between/O domain/O name/O of/O the/O SSL/O certificate/O and/O common/O name/O of/O the/O subject/O field/O in/O it/O ./O 
For/O instance/O ,/O if/O the/O hostname/O and/O common/O name/O are/O www.google.com.sa/O and/O google.com/O respectively/O ,/O host-common-name-sim/O is/O set/O to/O true/O ./O 
Whereas/O ,/O if/O the/O hostname/O and/O common/O name/O are/O equal/O to/O www.domain-x.com/O and/O www.domain-y.com/O ,/O respectively/O ,/O the/O feature/O is/O set/O to/O false/O since/O domain-x/O is/O not/O equal/O to/O domain-y/O ./O 
74.3/O %/O of/O Alexa/O certificates/O satisfies/O this/O feature/O ./O

Our/O classifier/O does/O not/O provide/O a/O complete/O standalone/O solution/O to/O the/O phishing/O threat/O since/O many/O domains/O do/O not/O have/O HTTPS/O ./O 
Instead/O ,/O integrated/O with/O pre-existing/O solutions/O -LRB-/O e.g./O ,/O How/O malicious/O domains/O will/O adapt/O ./O

We/O hope/O that/O this/O work/O will/O raise/O the/O bar/O and/O make/O it/O more/O difficult/O for/O web-fraudsters/O to/O deceive/O users/O ./O 
If/O web-browsers/O use/O our/O classifier/O to/O alyze/O SSL/O certificate/O fields/O ,/O we/O expect/O one/O of/O two/O responses/O from/O web-fraudsters/O :/O -LRB-/O 1/O -RRB-/O to/O acquire/O legitimate/O certificates/O from/O CAs/O and/O leave/O a/O paper/O trail/O pointing/O to/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O some/O person/O or/O organization/O ''/O ''/O ''/O ''/O which/O is/O connected/O to/O such/O malicious/O activities/O ,/O -LRB-/O 2/O -RRB-/O to/O craft/O certificates/O that/O have/O similar/O values/O to/O those/O that/O are/O most/O common/O in/O certificates/O of/O legitimate/O domains/O ./O 
Some/O fields/features/O will/O be/O easy/O to/O forge/O with/O legitimate/O values/O -LRB-/O e.g./O ,/O country/O of/O issuer/O ,/O country/O of/O subject/O ,/O subject/O common/O and/O organization/O name/O ,/O validity/O period/O ,/O signature/O algorithm/O ,/O serial/O number/O .../O etc/O -RRB-/O ./O

Related/O Work/O The/O work/O in/O Conclusion/O In/O this/O paper/O ,/O we/O study/O the/O prevalence/O of/O HTTPS/O in/O popular/O and/O legitimate/O domains/O as/O well/O as/O in/O the/O context/O of/O web-fraud/O ,/O i.e./O ,/O phishing/O and/O typosquatting/O ./O 
To/O the/O best/O of/O our/O knowledge/O ,/O this/O is/O the/O first/O effort/O to/O analyze/O information/O in/O SSL/O certificates/O to/O profile/O domains/O and/O assess/O their/O degree/O of/O trustworthiness/O ./O

The/O classifier/O solely/O relies/O on/O SSL/O certificates/O of/O such/O domains/O ,/O thus/O preserving/O user/O privacy/O ./O 
Our/O work/O can/O be/O integrated/O with/O existing/O detection/O techniques/O to/O improve/O their/O effectiveness/O ./O 
Finally/O ,/O we/O believe/O that/O our/O results/O may/O serve/O as/O a/O motivation/O to/O increase/O the/O adoption/O of/O HTTPS/O ./O 
We/O believe/O that/O aside/O from/O its/O intended/O benefits/O of/O confidentiality/O and/O authenticity/O ,/O HTTPS/O can/O help/O identify/O web-fraud/O domains/O ./O ''/O 
Introduction/O ''/O With/O the/O cheap/O costs/O of/O communication/O ,/O the/O convenience/O of/O network/O storage/O and/O network/O connectivity/O ,/O and/O easier/O access/O such/O as/O the/O S3/O provided/O by/O Amazon/O or/O AppEngine/O provided/O by/O Google/O ,/O many/O small/O enterprises/O -LRB-/O data/O owners/O in/O our/O approach/O ,/O simplified/O for/O DOs/O -RRB-/O resort/O to/O delegate/O their/O data/O storage/O and/O database/O management/O to/O one/O or/O more/O DSPs/O ./O 
Database/O as/O a/O Service/O ,/O DaaS/O for/O short/O ,/O caters/O to/O these/O requirements/O and/O allows/O enterprises/O to/O delegate/O their/O data/O management/O and/O data/O storage/O to/O DSPs/O so/O as/O to/O relieve/O them/O from/O excess/O costs/O of/O employing/O DBA/M professionals/O and/O associated/O hardware/O and/O software/O ./O 
Access/O control/O ,/O an/O important/O security/O mechanism/O in/O traditional/O DBMS/O ,/O allows/O different/O users/O to/O have/O different/O access/O privileges/O ./O 
However/O ,/O the/O DaaS/O paradigm/O ,/O different/O from/O traditional/O client-server/O architecture/O in/O which/O the/O server/O is/O trusted/O and/O responsible/O for/O designing/O and/O enforcing/O the/O access/O control/O policy/O ,/O is/O challenged/O because/O the/O DSP/O himself/herself/O is/O untrusted/O and/O may/O be/O one/O of/O the/O internal/O attackers/O ./O 
Therefore/O in/O DaaS/O paradigm/O if/O the/O trusted/O data/O owner/O is/O responsible/O for/O filtering/O unauthorized/O access/O to/O delegated/O database/O at/O DSP/O for/O each/O user/O in/O client/O ,/O he/she/O will/O become/O the/O communication/O and/O performance/O bottleneck/O ./O 
Therefore/O it/O is/O necessary/O to/O enforce/O selective/O authorization/O on/O delegated/O database/O by/O DSP/M ,/O at/O the/O same/O time/O to/O guarantee/O the/O confidentiality/O of/O the/O delegated/O sensitive/O data/O ./O 
Different/O from/O the/O proposed/O approaches/O 2/O -RRB-/O In/O our/O approach/O ,/O the/O DSP/O can/O implement/O the/O selective/O authorization/O enforcement/O management/O by/O using/O delegated/O access/O control/O authorization/O tables/O and/O the/O re-encryption/O module/O ./O 
3/O -RRB-/O Our/O approach/O is/O efficient/O ./O 
The/O users/O in/O client/O need/O little/O computation/O knowledge/O to/O derive/O keys/O for/O authorized/O tuples/O ,/O but/O only/O need/O to/O use/O his/O own/O private/O key/O to/O decrypt/O all/O the/O authorized/M encrypted/M tuples/M filtered/M and/O returned/O directly/O by/O DSP/O ./O 
4/O -RRB-/O Our/O approach/O provides/O dynamic/O policy/O updating/O and/O managing/O ./O 
Whenever/O the/O granting/O or/O revoking/O operations/O take/O place/O ,/O both/O the/O data/O owner/O and/O the/O DSP/O update/O the/O access/O control/O authorization/O tables/O by/O invoking/O the/O standard/O SQL/O updating/O statement/O ./O 
Paper/O Organization/O ./O 
The/O rest/O of/O this/O paper/O is/O organized/O as/O follows/O ./O 
In/O Section/O 2/O we/O first/O describe/O the/O introduced/O DSP/O re-encryption/O based/O system/O architecture/O ,/O and/O then/O Section/O 3/O introduces/O our/O DSP/O re-encryption/O mechanism/O and/O the/O first/O level/O encryption/O completed/O by/O data/O owner/O ./O

CS/O Sum/O i/O =/O i/O j/O =/O 1/O CS/O J/O -LRB-/O 1/O -RRB-/O CU/O Sum/O i/O =/O i/O j/O =/O 1/O CU/O J/O -LRB-/O 2/O -RRB-/O CodeSum/O =/O min/O -LRB-/O n/O i/O =/O 1/O |/O CS/O Sum/O i/O |/O ,/O n/O i/O =/O 1/O |/O CU/O Sum/O i/O |/O -RRB-/O max/O -LRB-/O n/O i/O =/O 1/O |/O CS/O Sum/O i/O |/O ,/O n/O i/O =/O 1/O |/O CU/O Sum/O i/O |/O -RRB-/O -LRB-/O 3/O -RRB-/O Equations/O -1/O and/O -LRB-/O 2/O -RRB-/O are/O used/O for/O the/O computation/O of/O the/O ith/O accumulated/O value/O ./O 
In/O Equation/O -LRB-/O 3/O -RRB-/O ,/O CodeSum/O is/O defined/O as/O the/O minimum/O sum/O of/O CS/O Sum/O i/O or/O CU/O Sum/O i/O divided/O by/O the/O maximum/O sum/O ./O

The/O result/O of/O CodeSum/M is/O within/O zero/O to/O one/O ./O 
If/O the/O result/O is/O close/O to/O one/O ,/O this/O means/O that/O the/O CodeSums/O of/O the/O sample/O and/O unknown/O programs/O are/O close/O ./O 
Otherwise/O ,/O the/O result/O is/O close/O to/O zero/O ./O 
For/O example/O ,/O assume/O that/O the/O values/O of/O two/O curve/O codes/O ,/O `/O SBb/O '/O and/O `/O OAC/O '/O ,/O are/O 19/O ,/O 2/O ,/O In/O Equation/O -LRB-/O 4/O -RRB-/O ,/O minCurveCode/O is/O defined/O as/O the/O minimum/O value/O among/O all/O of/O CS/O i/O and/O CU/O i/O ./O

For/O the/O same/O curve/O codes/O `/O SBb/O '/O and/O `/O OAC/O '/O ,/O the/O values/O are/O 19/O ,/O 2/O ,/O -2/O and/O 16/O ,/O 1/O ,/O 3/O ,/O respectively/O ./O 
minCurveCode/O equals/O -2/O ./O 
CodeDif/O f/O Sum/O equals/O 1/O ?/O -LRB-/O 3/O +/O 2/O +/O 5/O -RRB-/O //O -LRB-/O 21/O +/O 4/O +/O 5/O -RRB-/O ,/O i.e./O ,/O 0.7/O ./O 
3/O -RRB-/O U/O sageSum/O :/O The/O measurement/O is/O based/O on/O the/O sum/O of/O memory/O usages/O ./O 
Assume/O there/O are/O n/O memory/O usages/O ./O 
The/O ith/O usage/O of/O the/O sample/O and/O unknown/O program/O is/O denoted/O by/O U/O S/O i/O and/O U/O U/O i/O ,/O respectively/O ./O

In/O this/O equation/O ,/O the/O minimum/O sum/O of/O memory/O usages/O is/O divided/O by/O the/O maximum/O sum/O of/O the/O memory/O usages/O ./O 
The/O result/O is/O within/O zero/O to/O one/O ./O 
If/O the/O result/O is/O close/O to/O one/O ,/O it/O means/O that/O the/O usage/O sum/O of/O two/O programs/O is/O similar/O ./O 
Otherwise/O ,/O the/O result/O is/O close/O to/O zero/O ./O 
For/O example/O ,/O the/O usages/O of/O two/O programs/O are/O 3868/O ,/O 3984/O ,/O 4020/O and/O 4000/O ,/O 3510/O ,/O 2000/O ,/O respectively/O ./O

A/O most/O important/O type/O of/O network/O is/O the/O feed/O forward/O neural/O network/O shown/O in/O y/O k/O =/O f/O ko/O -LRB-/O N/O j/O =/O 1/O W/O h/O jk/O f/O k/O -LRB-/O p/O j/O =/O 1/O W/O I/O ji/O X/O i/O +/O b/O j/O -RRB-/O +/O b/O 0/O -RRB-/O Where/O @BULLET/O W/O h/O jk/O is/O connection/O weight/O from/O hidden/O layer/O to/O output/O @BULLET/O W/O I/O ji/O is/O connection/O weight/O from/O input/O to/O hidden/O layer/O @BULLET/O b/O 0/O is/O bias/O of/O output/O @BULLET/O b/O j/O is/O bias/O of/O hidden/O layer/O @BULLET/O f/O k/O is/O activation/O function/O of/O hidden/O layer/O ,/O and/O @BULLET/O f/O ko/O is/O activation/O function/O of/O output/O layer/O Learning/O in/O Neural/O Networks/O Learning/O in/O the/O context/O of/O neural/M networks/M is/O the/O process/O of/O adjusting/O the/O connection/O weights/O and/O biases/O such/O that/O for/O a/O given/O input/O a/O desired/O output/O is/O achieved/O ./O 
There/O are/O two/O basic/O training/O modes/O ./O 
1/O -RRB-/O Supervised/M learning/M -/O This/O is/O a/O learning/O paradigm/O where/O the/O neural/O network/O is/O given/O samples/O of/O the/O input/O and/O desired/O output/O and/O the/O error/O between/O the/O desired/O output/O and/O the/O actual/O output/O of/O the/O neural/O network/O is/O used/O to/O adjust/O the/O connection/O weights/O ./O 
A/O famous/O algorithm/O of/O supervised/M learning/M is/O back/O prop/O -/O agation/O ./O 
2/O -RRB-/O Unsupervised/M learning/M -/O This/O does/O not/O need/O any/O feedback/O for/O adjustment/O of/O the/O weights/O ./O 
Back/M Propagation/M Algorithm/M Back/M propagation/M is/O a/O famous/O algorithm/O used/O to/O train/O neural/O networks/O ./O

J/O =/O 1/O M/O M/O j/O =/O 1/O -LRB-/O d/O j/O ?/O y/O j/O -RRB-/O 2/O where/O d/O j/O and/O y/O j/O are/O the/O desired/O and/O actual/O network/O out/O -/O puts/O ./O

Introduction/O ''/O Undeniable/O signature/O was/O introduced/O by/O Chaum/O and/O van/O Antwerpen/O in/O 1990/O Bilinear/O Pairings/O Let/O G/O 1/O be/O an/O additive/O group/O of/O prime/O order/O q/O and/O G/O 2/O be/O a/O multiplicative/O group/O of/O the/O same/O order/O ./O 
A/O cryptographic/O bilinear/O pairing/O is/O a/O mappingêmappingˆmappingê/O :/O G/O 1/O ×/O G/O 1/O ?/O G/O 2/O that/O satisfies/O the/O following/O properties/O :/O @BULLET/O Bilinearity/O :/O ?/O P/O ,/O Q/O ?/O G/O 1/O ,/O ?/O a/O ,/O b/O ?/O Z/O */O q/O ,/O we/O havêhavê/O e/O -LRB-/O aP/O ,/O bQ/O -RRB-/O =/O ˆ/O e/O -LRB-/O P/O ,/O Q/O -RRB-/O ab/O ./O 
@BULLET/O Non-degeneracy/O :/O ?/O P/O ?/O G/O 1/O ,/O if/O P/O =/O 0/O ,/O thenêthenˆthenê/O -LRB-/O P/O ,/O P/O -RRB-/O =/O 1/O ./O 
@BULLET/O Computability/O :/O The/O mappingêmappingˆmappingê/O can/O be/O efficiently/O computed/O ./O 
H/O 2/O :/O -LCB-/O 0/O ,/O 1/O -RCB-/O ×/O -LCB-/O 0/O ,/O 1/O -RCB-/O ×/O -LCB-/O 0/O ,/O 1/O -RCB-/O ?/O G/O 1/O ,/O H/O 3/O :/O G/O 3/O 2/O ?/O Z/O q/O and/O H/O 4/O :/O G/O 4/O 2/O ?/O Z/O q/O ./O 
It/O randomly/O chooses/O a/O master/O key/O s/O ?/O Z/O q/O and/O computes/O the/O corresponding/O public/O key/O P/O pub/O =/O sP/O ?/O G/O 1/O ./O 
The/O system/O 's/O parameters/O are/O params/O :/O =/O -LCB-/O q/O ,/O G/O 1/O ,/O G/O 2/O ,/O ˆ/O e/O ,/O P/O ,/O P/O pub/O ,/O H/O 1/O ,/O H/O 2/O ,/O H/O 3/O ,/O H/O 4/O -RCB-/O @BULLET/O Keygen/O :/O Given/O a/O user/O -LRB-/O signer/O or/O verifier/O -RRB-/O with/O an/O identity/O ID/O ,/O the/O PKG/O computes/O Q/O ID/O =/O H/O 1/O -LRB-/O ID/O -RRB-/O ?/O G/O 1/O and/O the/O associated/O private/O key/O d/O ID/O =/O sQ/O ID/O ?/O G/O 1/O which/O will/O be/O transmitted/O to/O the/O user/O ./O 
@BULLET/O Sign/O :/O To/O sign/O a/O message/O M/O ?/O -LCB-/O 0/O ,/O 1/O -RCB-/O */O ,/O the/O signer/O Alice/O with/O identity/O ID/O A/O and/O private/O key/O d/O IDA/O computes/O ?/O =/O ˆ/O e/O -LRB-/O H/O 2/O -LRB-/O M/O ,/O r/O ,/O ID/O A/O -RRB-/O ,/O d/O IDA/O -RRB-/O ?/O G/O 2/O ,/O where/O r/O ?/O -LCB-/O 0/O ,/O 1/O -RCB-/O is/O a/O random/O string/O picked/O by/O Alice/O ./O 
Then/O ,/O the/O pair/O -LRB-/O r/O ,/O ?/O -RRB-/O is/O the/O signatur/O @BULLET/O Confirm/O :/O To/O verify/O the/O signature/O ,/O the/O designated/O verifier/O with/O identity/O ID/O B/O will/O run/O a/O confirmation/O protocol/O with/O the/O signer/O Alice/O to/O produce/O a/O proof/O -LRB-/O U/O ,/O v/O ,/O h/O ,/O S/O -RRB-/O ,/O where/O S/O =/O R/O +/O -LRB-/O h/O +/O v/O -RRB-/O d/O IDA/O ,/O h/O =/O H/O 3/O -LRB-/O c/O ,/O g/O 1/O ,/O g/O 2/O -RRB-/O ,/O U/O ?/O G/O 1/O ,/O R/O ?/O G/O 1/O and/O v/O ?/O Z/O q/O are/O randomly/O selected/O by/O the/O signer/O ,/O and/O c/O =/O ˆ/O e/O -LRB-/O P/O ,/O U/O -RRB-/O ˆ/O e/O -LRB-/O P/O pub/O ,/O Q/O IDB/O -RRB-/O ,/O g/O 1/O =/O ˆ/O e/O -LRB-/O P/O ,/O R/O -RRB-/O ?/O G/O 2/O and/O g/O 2/O =/O ˆ/O e/O -LRB-/O H/O 2/O -LRB-/O M/O ,/O r/O ,/O ID/O A/O -RRB-/O ,/O R/O -RRB-/O ?/O G/O 2/O ./O

This/O misleads/O the/O recipient/O node/O to/O calculate/O a/O low/O cost/O for/O the/O link/O and/O thus/O selects/O the/O malicious/O node/O as/O its/O MPR/O ./O

Identity/O Spoofing/O Since/O no/O authentication/O takes/O place/O ,/O a/O malicious/O node/O can/O masquerade/O as/O another/O node/O -LRB-/O identity/O spoofing/O -RRB-/O ./O 
When/O the/O neighboring/O nodes/O receive/O its/O Hello/O packets/O ,/O they/O will/O be/O misled/O to/O believe/O that/O the/O claimed/O node/O is/O within/O their/O range/O ./O 
Later/O on/O ,/O the/O deluded/O nodes/O will/O advertise/O themselves/O as/O the/O last/O hop/O to/O the/O intruder/O -LRB-/O which/O they/O mistakenly/O believe/O to/O be/O the/O legitimate/O node/O -RRB-/O ./O

Theorem/O 3/O ./O

Proof/O ./O 
The/O proof/O follows/O on/O similar/O lines/O to/O Assume/O that/O n/O k/O -LRB-/O k/O =/O 2/O -RRB-/O forwards/O the/O packet/O P/O to/O node/O d./O Assume/O there/O exists/O a/O path/O n/O k/O ?/O nk/O ?/O 1/O ?/O n/O k/O ?/O 2/O ?/O .../O ?/O n/O 2/O ?/O n/O 1/O ?/O d./O Based/O on/O Lemma/O 1/O ,/O any/O packet/O received/O by/O n/O k/O ?/O 1/O from/O n/O k/O must/O be/O relayed/O to/O n/O k/O ?/O 2/O ./O

This/O means/O that/O no/O entries/O will/O be/O added/O in/O the/O one-hop/O or/O two/O hop/O tables/O ./O

In/O the/O past/O ,/O people/O usually/O use/O pens/O to/O sign/O important/O messages/O however/O ,/O since/O the/O digital/O message/O has/O replaced/O traditional/O paper/O ,/O people/O have/O started/O to/O use/O digital/O signatures/O to/O sign/O digital/O messages/O ./O 
Although/O many/O researchers/O have/O designed/O different/O signature/O applications/O with/O different/O requirements/O ,/O like/O blind/O signatures/O 1/O -RRB-/O Integrity/O :/O When/O a/O person/O can/O verify/O the/O received/O message/O and/O signature/O ,/O he/O or/O she/O can/O ensure/O that/O the/O message/O has/O not/O been/O modified/O by/O someone/O else/O during/O the/O transmission/O time/O ./O 
2/O -RRB-/O Unforgeability/O :/O By/O verifying/O the/O received/O message/O and/O signature/O ,/O people/O easily/O can/O verify/O the/O legal/O identity/O of/O the/O signer/O ./O 
Conversely/O ,/O the/O people/O who/O verify/O the/O signature/O can/O make/O sure/O that/O no/O one/O else/O is/O using/O a/O fake/O signature/O and/O message/O to/O impersonate/O the/O real/O signer/O ./O 
3/O -RRB-/O Non-repudiation/O :/O When/O someone/O maliciously/O denies/O a/O message/O and/O signature/O that/O he/O or/O she/O had/O signed/O ,/O a/O good/O signature/O scheme/O can/O identify/O the/O true/O provider/O of/O the/O signature/O ./O 
In/O short/O ,/O the/O signature/O must/O protect/O the/O verifier/O ,/O in/O case/O he/O or/O she/O becomes/O the/O victim/O ./O 
In/O a/O traditional/O digital/O signature/O system/O ,/O the/O signer/O normally/O holds/O two/O keys/O ,/O a/O private/O key/O and/O a/O public/O key/O ./O 
The/O private/O key/O can/O be/O used/O for/O signing/O important/O messages/O ,/O and/O give/O the/O corresponding/O public/O key/O to/O the/O certificate/O authority/O and/O verifier/O ./O 
The/O certificate/O authority/O -LRB-/O CA/M -RRB-/O stores/O and/O manages/O every/O user/O 's/O public/O key/O ./O 
Once/O the/O verifier/O receives/O a/O signature/O from/O a/O signer/O and/O wants/O to/O verify/O it/O ,/O CA/O will/O give/O the/O corresponding/O certificate/O to/O the/O verifier/O which/O includes/O the/O signer/O 's/O public/O key/O ./O 
Hence/O ,/O the/O verifier/O can/O verify/O the/O certificate/O and/O the/O signer/O 's/O public/O key/O immediately/O ./O 
It/O is/O secure/O and/O very/O convenient/O but/O places/O a/O heavy/O burden/O on/O CA/O because/O the/O CA/O has/O to/O store/O and/O manage/O many/O certificates/O ./O

=/O h/O ./O

Our/O proposed/O scheme/O can/O be/O divided/O into/O four/O phases/O :/O 1/O -RRB-/O setup/O phase/O ,/O 2/O -RRB-/O blinding/O phase/O ,/O 3/O -RRB-/O signing/O phase/O and/O 4/O -RRB-/O verifying/O phase/O ./O

Since/O AMBTC/O is/O a/O one-bit/O quantizer/O ,/O ?/O is/O utilized/O as/O a/O threshold/O for/O binarizing/O all/O the/O pixels/O in/O each/O block/O into/O two/O clusters/O with/O p/O and/O k/O ?/O p/O pixels/O ,/O individually/O ./O

Signcrypt/O ./O

Goal/O 1/O :/O Inconsistency/O in/O CSP/O Enforcement/O ./O

There/O is/O an/O inconsistency/O in/O CSP/O supporting/O browsers/O in/O CSP/O enforcement/O headers/O they/O obey/O ./O

6/O -RRB-/O Perfect/O forward/O secrecy/O :/O In/O case/O ,/O the/O passwords/O P/O A/O ,/O and/O P/O B/O of/O the/O users/O A/O and/O B/O are/O compromised/O ,/O the/O attacker/O can/O not/O calculate/O the/O session/O key/O as/O P/O 1/O and/O P/O 2/O are/O unknown/O ./O

4/O -RRB-/O On/O input/O T/O B/O ,/O run/O BasisDel/O -LRB-/O B/O ,/O -LRB-/O R/O µw/O ·/O ·/O ·/O R/O µ/O k/O +1/O -RRB-/O ·/O -LRB-/O R/O µ/O k/O -LSB-/O ?/O 1/O -RSB-/O k/O ,/O ?1/O ·/O ·/O ·/O R/O µ/O k/O -LSB-/O j/O +1/O -RSB-/O k/O ,/O j/O +1/O -RRB-/O ,/O T/O B/O ,/O ?/O k/O -RRB-/O to/O generate/O a/O private/O key/O for/O ID/O and/O sends/O the/O result/O to/O A./O +/O n/O -LRB-/O m/O 1/O +/O k?/O 1/O m/O 1/O -RRB-/O 2/O -LRB-/O 1/O +/O k?/O 1/O +/O ?/O 2/O -RRB-/O m/O 1/O +/O n/O This/O work/O -LRB-/O n/O +/O 2l?/O 1/O m/O 2/O +/O ?/O 2/O n/O -RRB-/O m/O 2/O +/O n/O -LRB-/O m/O 2/O -RRB-/O 2/O 2m/O 2/O +/O n/O Sign/O queries/O :/O On/O input/O a/O message/O M/O and/O an/O identity/O ID/O :/O @BULLET/O If/O ID/O =/O ID/O */O ,/O then/O F/O ID/O */O =/O A/O -LRB-/O R/O µ/O */O l/O ·/O ·/O ·/O R/O µ/O */O 1/O -RRB-/O ?/O 1/O =/O A/O 0/O ./O

-4/O where/O ,/O The/O sender/O overhead/O ,/O receiver/O overhead/O ,/O ,/O and/O 1/O are/O very/O small/O with/O respect/O to/O the/O message/O latency/O ./O

Asynchronous/M communication/M mechanism/M The/O number/O of/O hops/O between/O P/O i/O and/O P/O j/O hop/O -LRB-/O P/O i/O ,/O P/O j/O -RRB-/O equals/O one/O for/O all/O i/O ,/O j/O -LRB-/O fully/O connection/O -RRB-/O ./O
